PIC registers address

#define EOI   0x20
 End Of Interrupt Command */.
#define PIC1_CMD   0x20
 PIC1 register address to send EOI */.
#define PIC2_CMD   0xA0
 PIC2 register address to send EOI */.
#define PIC1_MASK   0x21
 PIC1 register address to read/write interrupt mask */.
#define PIC2_MASK   0xA1
 PIC2 register address to read/write interrupt mask */.

 Timer 0.

Some usefull definitions

#define IRQ_MASK_BIT(irq)   ((irq) < 8 ? 1 << (irq) : (1 << (irq)) >> 8)
#define IRQ_VECTOR(irq)   ((irq) < 8 ? (irq) + 0x08 : (irq) - 8 + 0x70)

#define IRQ_MASK_BIT ( irq   )     ((irq) < 8 ? 1 << (irq) : (1 << (irq)) >> 8)

Gives mask bit associated with a given irq. Warning, if irq > 7 the result must be applied to PIC2

#define IRQ_VECTOR ( irq   )     ((irq) < 8 ? (irq) + 0x08 : (irq) - 8 + 0x70)

gives the vector associated with a given IRQ

Function Documentation

int install_asm_irq_handler ( int  irq,
void(*)(void)  irq_func,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  old_irq 
)

Installs the ASM written function 'irq_func' as the interrupt handler associated with interrupt 'irq', updating the 'old_irq' structure with the current interrupt handler. Returns 0 on success or -1 on error, in which case the original interrupt handler remains installed.

See reinstall_asm_irq_handler() to reinstall the original handler.

int install_c_irq_handler ( int  irq,
void(*)(void)  irq_func,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  old_irq,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  new_irq 
)

Installs the C written 'irq_func' interrupt handler at the interrupt handler associated with interrupt 'irq', updating the old_irq structure with the current interrupt handler. Returns 0 on success or -1 on error, in which case the original interrupt handler remains installed.

See reinstall_c_irq_handler() to reinstall the original handler.

void mask_pic ( int  irq  ) 

Mask the bit corresponding to 'irq', disabling its interrupts. The correct PIC is used.

void reinstall_asm_irq_handler ( int  irq,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  old_irq 
)

Reinstalls the interrupt handler specified in 'old_irq' for interrupt 'irq'. See install_asm_irq_handler().

void reinstall_c_irq_handler ( int  irq,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  old_irq,
_go32_dpmi_seginfo *  new_irq 
)

Reinstalls the interrupt handler specified in 'old_irq' for interrupt 'irq'. See install_c_irq_handler().

void unmask_pic ( int  irq  ) 

Unmask the bit corresponding to 'irq', enabling its interrupts. The correct PIC is used.
